page.title: 17The Court Leet 'A'.
page.content: After 1066,William the Conquerer 'gave' the lands he had won to some of his best friends,they were Norman Lords.In places like Newport the local Welsh people had to give up all control of the economic life of the community.The lord now set up two courts and got locals to serve on them by making them BURGESSES and offering them rented accommodation,fertile land,water rights, forest rights and were able to trade free of tolls in the markets and fairs. The first court was the COURT LEET which met twice each year,it was responsible for collecting fines,listing burgesses and their occupations,appointing new burgesses as well as taking good care of the lord's property at all times.It had also to appoint 15 Jurors each year to serve on the HUNDRED(or AREA) COURT.
